interpret: A force that draws something towards itself.
exampleSentence: She felt the pull of the ocean current.

interpret: A force that pulls things together.
exampleSentence: Magnetic attraction pulls iron filings to the magnet.

interpret: The state of not being acted on by gravity.
exampleSentence: Astronauts experience weightlessness in space.

interpret: A piece of text, a formal suggestion, or a drawing in its original state, often containing the main ideas and intentions but not the developed form.
exampleSentence: This is just the first draft of my novel.

interpret: The written text of a play, movie, or broadcast.
exampleSentence: The actors read through the script together.

interpret: A cloth made by hand or machine.
exampleSentence: The country is famous for its fine textiles.

interpret: A physical substance that things can be made from.
exampleSentence: Leather is a durable material for shoes.

interpret: The long, narrow stage that models walk along in a fashion show.
exampleSentence: The supermodel dominated the catwalk.

interpret: A person whose job is to shape or design things, especially clothes or hair.
exampleSentence: Her stylist chose a stunning dress for the event.

interpret: A person who creates something.
exampleSentence: He is the creator of a popular fashion brand.

interpret: A style, activity, or interest that is very popular for a short period of time.
exampleSentence: Fidget spinners were just a passing fad.

interpret: A group of people with a common aim or a change in general opinion.
exampleSentence: The minimalist movement is influencing modern design.

interpret: A large exhibition.
exampleSentence: We attended the technology expo in Tokyo.

interpret: The view behind something.
exampleSentence: The mountains provided a perfect backdrop for the photo.

interpret: A system of wires through which electricity is connected.
exampleSentence: The power grid failed during the storm.

meaningVi: không khí / môi trường xung quanh
interpret: The character of a place or the quality it seems to have.
exampleSentence: The restaurant has a romantic ambience.

interpret: A poisonous substance.
exampleSentence: Tests showed high levels of toxins in the water.

interpret: To process something again in order to reuse it.
exampleSentence: The plant handles the reprocessing of nuclear fuel.

interpret: The quality of being able to last a long time without becoming damaged.
exampleSentence: This material is known for its durability.

meaningVi: khả năng tồn tại / tính khả thi
interpret: Ability to work as intended or to succeed.
exampleSentence: The viability of the project depends on funding.

interpret: Without limits or ending.
exampleSentence: Solar power is theoretically an infinite resource.

interpret: A black powder produced when coal, wood, etc. is burnt.
exampleSentence: The chimney sweep was covered in soot.

interpret: A region of the earth's surface and the particular combination of climate, plants, and animals that are found in it.
exampleSentence: The tropical rainforest is a diverse biome.

interpret: The number of different species represented in an ecological community.
exampleSentence: The Amazon basin has incredible species richness.

meaningVi: sự quản lý / cương vị quản lý
interpret: Supervising or taking care of something, such as an organization or property.
exampleSentence: Environmental stewardship is key to saving the planet.

meaningVi: ca phẫu thuật / sự vận hành
interpret: An occasion when a doctor cuts a body for medical reasons in order to repair, remove, or replace a diseased or damaged part.
exampleSentence: He is recovering from a knee operation.

interpret: The process of becoming immune to a disease.
exampleSentence: Mass immunization has eradicated polio in many countries.

meaningVi: hiệu thuốc (thường có bán tạp hóa)
interpret: A shop where you can buy medicines, make-up, and sometimes food and drinks.
exampleSentence: I stopped at the drugstore to buy some vitamins.

meaningVi: phòng pha chế thuốc / trạm xá
interpret: A place where medicines are prepared and given out.
exampleSentence: The village dispensary provides basic medicines.

meaningVi: sự giáo dục ở nhà trường
interpret: Education at school.
exampleSentence: He had very little formal schooling.

interpret: The process of judging or calculating the quality, importance, amount, or value of something.
exampleSentence: The teacher's evaluation helped me improve my writing.

interpret: A piece of work to be done, especially one done regularly, unwillingly, or with difficulty.
exampleSentence: Completing the report was a difficult task.

interpret: A talk giving information about something.
exampleSentence: She gave a presentation on marketing strategies.

interpret: An amount of money given especially by the government to a person or organization for a special purpose.
exampleSentence: The university received a research grant.

interpret: An official process to discover the facts about something bad that has happened.
exampleSentence: A judicial inquiry was ordered into the accident.

interpret: A person who writes novels.
exampleSentence: Dickens is a famous Victorian novelist.

meaningVi: phép tương tự / sự so sánh
interpret: A comparison between things that have similar features, often used to help explain a principle or idea.
exampleSentence: He drew an analogy between the brain and a computer.

meaningVi: nghệ thuật sân khấu / hành động kịch tính
interpret: Plays and other entertainments performed in a theatre.
exampleSentence: He is known for his onstage theatrics.

interpret: The general appearance of the natural environment, especially when it is beautiful.
exampleSentence: We stopped to admire the breathtaking scenery.

interpret: A series of musical notes, especially one that is pleasant and easy to remember.
exampleSentence: He whistled a happy tune.

interpret: Clothes, especially of a particular or formal type.
exampleSentence: Business attire is required for the interview.

interpret: A person who watches an activity, especially a sports event, without taking part.
exampleSentence: Thousands of spectators cheered for their team.

interpret: A place where things are stored and can be found.
exampleSentence: The library is a repository of knowledge.

interpret: The process of changing from working largely or exclusively by hand or with animals to doing that work with machinery.
exampleSentence: The mechanization of agriculture increased crop yields.

interpret: Money given by a government or organization for an event or activity.
exampleSentence: The project received government funding.

interpret: The amount of money that someone is paid for working.
exampleSentence: Average earnings have increased this year.

interpret: Someone who establishes a business, organization, school, etc.
exampleSentence: She is the founder of a successful tech startup.
